intro: Oreopanax xalapensis var. spiciformis, commonly known as the spiciform spurge, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, succulent stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
